title.narrative: Capacity building of the Serbian Republic Geodetic Authority

description.narrative:
Svenska Lantmäteriet och Republic Geodetic Authority (RGA) i Serbien lade fram ett förslag till Sida om finansiering med 20 195 400 kronor för att genomföra projektet "Improvement of Investment Environment" i Serbien under perioden 2018-2020. Insatsen syftar till att etablera ett nationellt register över investeringskartor (NRIM) för skapande, underhåll och övervakning av kommersiella fastigheten med investerings möjlighet i Serbien, inklusive en plattform för intressentkommunikation och beslutsfattande. Insatsens totala budget är 20 195 400 kronor och den ska finansieras helt från Sidas bidrag.
Projektet förväntas möjliggöra utnyttjandet av den fulla potentialen avseende geospatial data för en effektiv politik för ekonomisk utveckling och affärsverksamhet i Serbien genom förbättrat stöd från RGA.

Swedish Lantmäteriet and the Republic Geodetic Authority of Serbia have applied to Sida for funding of 20 195 400 SEK to carry out "Improvement of Investment Environment" project in Serbia during the period 2018-2020. The intervention aims to establish a National Register of Investment Maps (NRIM) for creation, maintenance and monitoring of investment locations for the territory of the Republic of Serbia with a platform for stakeholder communication and decision making. Lantmäteriet will implement the intervention together with the Republic Geodetic Authority of Serbia. The intervention’s total budget is 20 195 400 SEK and it shall be completely funded from Sida contribution.
Project is expected to ensure and utilize a full potential of geospatial data in managing an effective policy of development and operation in the public institutions of the Republic of Serbia through the support of the Republic Geodetic Authority of Serbia.

The intervention aims to support the Republic Geodetic Authority of Serbia (RGA) to establish well functioning National Register of Investment Maps (NRIM). The key objective of the contribution is establishment NRIM for creation, maintenance and monitoring of investment locations for the territory of Republic of Serbia with a platform for stakeholder communication and decision making. Towards the end of the implementation period, the project is expected to achieve the following results: - Establishment of the National Investment Map Model - A system for collecting data on investment locations on a local level is created - Built capacities of local self-governments for attracting investments by presenting available resources to potential investors and land management - Establishment of direct and transparent channel of communication between investors and a local government „Location pool” as a part of NRIM. - Public monitoring & visibility tool for National Register of Investment Maps The proposal focuses on Spatial Data Infrastructure (SDI) as potential game-changing for development as it allows governments to integrate planning, investments, taxation, disaster risk management and climate change monitoring, mitigation and adaptation in new ways with great savings in time and funds, while improving overall service and governance. With constant technological improvements, society is able to actively use government’s data on daily base as well as to participate in the collecting new or maintaining existing data, which are at most importance for decision making on the governmental, regional and/or local level.

description.narrative: The main focus of the project during 2020 was on development of two tools of the National Register of Investment Maps (NRIM), the System for Data Collection and the Public Monitoring and Visibility Tool, preparation of the technical specification for the system “Location Pool” of the NRIM and training activities for the Republic Geodetic Authority (RGA) and the pilot municipalities. The main achievements could be summarized in the following way: - good communication and cooperation between RGA and the pilot municipalities - the Data Collection tool has been developed - the Public Monitoring and Visibility Tool has been developed - the technical specification for “Location Pool” has been prepared - a number of capacity building activities for the RGA and the pilot municipalities have been carried out - good and productive cooperation established with other stakeholders: relevant ministries, development partners (World Bank) - communication and visibility of the project were given high priority which resulted in rather frequent appearances of RGA staff and management in media (TV-including national broadcaster, but also Internet and printed media). The outbreak of COVID-19 continued to introduce challenges for the project implementation. All activities during 2020 and the first months of 2021 were implemented using digital tools for virtual meetings. The project had to adapt to the situation and find new ways of working. Despite the situation, the progress of the project is good. The gender perspective was carefully considered for each step of the project by ensuring equal opportunities for both men and women to participate in the project activities. All decisions were made in a way that views, interests and needs of both men and woman were taken into the account. During 2020, project worked towards all four outputs of the project: - A system for collecting data on investment locations on a local level is created: A system for data collection has been created, initially tested and accepted. - Built capacities of local self-governments for attracting investments by presenting available resources to potential investors and land management: Capacity of LGA has been improved via several capacity building activities carried out online due to the outbreak of COVID-19. - Establishment of direct and transparent channel of communication between investors and a local government “Location pool” as a part of NRIM: A technical specification for “Location Pool” has been prepared. A public procurement procedure has been carried out based on the specification. - Public Monitoring and Visibility Tool for National Register of Investment Maps: A Public Monitoring and Visibility Tool has been created, initially tested and accepted.
